issue.title: Needless UB for basic_string and basic_string_view

blockquote.p: Traits::char_type shall be the same as CharT.

discussion.p: Violating this seems to be a needless instance of undefined behavior, since the implementation can add a static_assert using the is_same type trait. A similar issue exists for basic_string_view in /1,

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4659.

blockquote.p: -3- To specialize those templates to generate a string or iostream class to handle a particular character container type CharT, that and its related character traits class Traits are passed as a pair of parameters to the string or iostream template as parameters charT and traits. If Traits::char_type shall be the same is not the same type as CharT, the program is ill-formed.

-3- […] In every specialization basic_string<charT, traits, Allocator>, the type traits shall satisfy the character traits requirements (). If, and the type traits::char_type shall name the same type is not the same type as charT, the program is ill-formed.

-1- In every specialization basic_string_view<charT, traits>, the type traits shall satisfy the character traits requirements (). If, and the type traits::char_type shall name the same type is not the same type as charT, the program is ill-formed.
